definition.description: Stores user profile data. Path-based ownership ensures only the user can access their profile.
Stores deals associated with each user. Path-based ownership ensures only the user can access their deals.
A root-level collection containing copies of all deals that users have publicly published for the community to see.
Stores comments made by the community on a specific published deal.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for security and scalability. User-specific data (profiles, private deals) is nested under `/users/{userId}` for strict, path-based security rules. A new root-level collection, `/publishedDeals`, is introduced to support the 'Community Deals' feature. When a user publishes a deal, a copy is placed in this collection, which has read-only access for all authenticated users. The `comments` subcollection is added to `publishedDeals` to allow community interaction on public deals, with rules allowing authenticated users to read and write comments.
